channel.author: Jenn Creighton
channel.description: Each season, single-threaded tackles a new topic in software engineering. This first season, we're exploring feelings. Why do we like some technologies but dislike others? How do our emotions come into play with our career choices? These are some of the questions we'll be answering this season. Episodes are a mix of guest interviews and solo musings. Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/single-threaded/support

item.dc:creator: Jenn Creighton
item.description:
Dana Jones, engineering manager at Netflix Studio, joins the podcast to talk about her experience developing and growing her direct reports. What does it look like to have a manager that invests in your growth? What steps can you & your manager take to plan for that growth?

Transcript

Show notes:

The Manager's Path

Resilient Management

--- Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/single-threaded/support

item.dc:creator: Jenn Creighton
item.description:
Rebecca Murphey (@rmurphey), an engineering manager in the developer productivity organization at Stripe, joins the podcast to discuss, well,  developer productivity. What is it and why do organizations invest in it? 

Transcript: https://dev.to/gurlcode/single-threaded-podcast-rebecca-murphey-on-developer-productivity-2m43

Show notes:

The SPACE of Developer Productivity

Managing a Core Server So People Don't Hate It

Product for Internal Platforms

item.dc:creator: Jenn Creighton
item.description:
Sara Vieira (@NikkitaFTW) is here to talk TypeScript... and why you shouldn't use it everywhere. We also reminiscence about Angular 1, explain The WordPress Problem...and maybe sing some Linkin Park.

Transcript: Coming soon!

Show notes:

  • Okay, I say TypeScript weird...
  • Loved this course: https://www.executeprogram.com/courses/typescript
  • Mike North's TS course on Frontend Masters: https://frontendmasters.com/courses/typescript-v2/
  • Effective TypeScript: https://effectivetypescript.com/
--- Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/single-threaded/support

item.title: Sara Vieira on TypeScript & The WordPress Problem

item.dc:creator: Jenn Creighton
item.description:
Crystal Martin (@codermeow) joins Jenn (@gurlcode) to explore why developers hesitate to ask for help, how to handle our mistakes, and the value of saying "I don't know".

Transcript: https://dev.to/gurlcode/single-threaded-podcast-crystal-martin-on-the-value-of-i-don-t-know-4mki

Show notes:

Follow Crystal on Twitter: https://twitter.com/codermeow

Her personal website: https://www.crystalmartin.co/

Crystal's talk at JSConf Hawaii 2019: JavaScript is asynchro-WHAT!?: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=el9fhSbby5E


--- Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/single-threaded/support

item.dc:creator: Jenn Creighton
item.description:
Erin Fox (@erinfoox) joins Jenn (@gurlcode) to talk about one of the most stressful parts of being a software developer: interviews. We talk about why interviewing in tech is nerve-racking, how to handle rejections and why, like dating, you should never commit too early.


Transcript: https://dev.to/gurlcode/single-threaded-podcast-erin-fox-on-interviewing-4f4l


Show notes:

Follow Erin on Twitter

Questions Erin asks a company when interviewing

Erin's “interviewing red flags” article


--- Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/single-threaded/support
item.itunes:summary:
Erin Fox (@erinfoox) joins Jenn (@gurlcode) to talk about one of the most stressful parts of being a software developer: interviews. We talk about why interviewing in tech is nerve-racking, how to handle rejections and why, like dating, you should never commit too early.


Transcript: https://dev.to/gurlcode/single-threaded-podcast-erin-fox-on-interviewing-4f4l

Each season, single-threaded tackles a new topic in software engineering. This first season, we're exploring feelings. Why do we like some technologies but dislike others? How do our emotions come into play with our career choices? These are some of the questions we'll be answering this season. Episodes are a mix of guest interviews and solo musings. Coming February 2021.
